When executing Data Warehouse Load Plans containing Star Marts, with the classic version of Qlik Sense configured: a Connection to Qlik Sense is now reused across Load Plan Executions. This is because Qlik Sense cannot close the connections promptly on the server after they are closed from the client. So this change is needed to avoid running out of available sessions, in case many Load Plans with Star Marts are executed back to back.

fixed findings in apigw and ims

gMSA account used to start service agents, and thereby starting services, must have a UPN assigned. This UPN will be used as the identity for the endpoints of the service. The endpoints will use FQDN instead of IP address. These changes will enable use of Kerberos for client and service authentication.

When a transaction is modified on a high status with a auxiliary job that has Now (outside commit sequence) then there is a timing issue that can trigger that the cancel job on the reversed transaction is triggered twice. This has been corrected.

When a SimCorp Dimension installation have too many open alerts (> 10.000) the Business rules alerts service could become unresponsive during processing of alert changes and therefore were shutdown by the service platform. The error has been fixed. In addition the service now logs a warning before every new change processing  in case the SimCorp Dimension installation has more than 10.000 open alerts.

When executing the batch job task "Performance Calculation - Upload Results" having "Upload decomposed funds" checked in the referenced "Investment Analytics Service - Data Source Configuration", a program error would occur in the case an Attribute Configuration was not set up for the investment analytics service. This regards transactions from the window ‘Exercise FX Options’ and similar transactions  in the Trade Manager. The calculation of the settlement amount as a sum of amount components should not be altered in the classical window.

In the 'Portfolio Calculation' wrongly an error message complaining about missing prices could appear, incase a position was lend out and part of a hedge relationship at the same time. This has been fixed.

For External and Internal message queues updated a mechanism that check if the data received from DB is correct and non-ambiguous. Add solution for cases when we retrieve only one data row with data info for requested transaction number.

When the same risk factor was mapped to multiple positions and imported sensitivities were used for pricing risk models (e.g., Monte Carlo, Historical), the imported sensitivities were taken incorrectly from Key Ratios Calculation =>Risk Factor Sensitivities. This issue has now been corrected.
Update of internal SimCorp tool, which does not affect any customer installations

A correction is made to the factor based FIPA fair cash flow on decomposed spot legs of IRF positions in Performance Calculation. This affects the fair cash flow itself as well as the factor based FIPA local return, when this is calculated using the TWR based approach. The correction ensures that the cash flow adjustment is consistently based on exposure, which removes spikes in the factor based FIPA local return on decomposed IRF positions on days with buy or sell transactions.
When using the formula function  'gettransfreecom' an unexpected amount of whitespaces was added. This has been fixed.

Rounding rules were not applied to the suggested margin amount for Margin Call with Return/Recall actions when the setting in Collateral Manager setup => Collateral Calculations => "Ignore MTA and rounding on full return/recall amount" is On. It was fixed.
A problem with generic payment matching using manual payment reconciliation and external netting was found and fixed

A crash could occur when creating swap orders from simulations via the Asset Manager. This was due to missing swap legs. The error handling has been improved and a proper error message is now provided instead.

For External and Internal message queues add a mechanism to check if the data received from DB (that is used to update Int and Ext message queues) represents the correct "Security" in scope of the requested "Transaction No".
Fix crashes on mapping counterparty exposure responses on Order Manager - Order service.
Technical changes to resolve an internal automatic test issue. No changes to any business logic.

CustomerApplyNote:
This change affects the way formulas of type "Key Ratio Mapping" are calculated. Before this change, formulas calling other formulas that returned an error AND the erroneous formula is also called on its own, the formula calling the erroneous formula was not marked as erroneous as it should. Now these kinds of formulas will also return an error.
This change can affect the output from “Pricing and Key Ratios Calculations”.
Example of a case that will work differently. F1 is calling F2. F2 fails (perhaps for some rows only). If the formulas are requested to be calculated in the order F2 then F1, then F1 did not fail even though there were errors in F2.

For security reasons it is now possible to specify SCD user ID for the configuration parameter CfgSvcGrantAllTasks.
Syntax:
CfgSvcGrantAllTasks=Enabled [;SCDID]
Enabled: 0 or 1
SCDID: SCD user ID

To be backward compatible the old syntax is still valid.

Examples:
CfgSvcGrantAllTasks=1 (the option is enabled)
CfgSvcGrantAllTasks=1;SCDID1 (the option is enabled if the current SCD user is SCDID1, for all other users it will be disabled).

Synthetic FX Hedge Return Calculation Settings currently supports four price methods that place the entire market value of the FX forward contract on one leg. It will therefore be the single leg that holds the entire P/L and return of the contract. There is, however, a conceptual problem with these methods, since the start of day market value on the value bearing leg is also zero. TWR is therefore not well defined on the opening date when using these price methods. The existing calculation applies a trick where the return is calculated on each leg and then simply subtracted from each other and put to the value bearing leg. One way to understand this approach is that it calculates a unitized P/L for each leg and moves these to the single leg. This approach is, however, difficult to understand and explain. On top of this, when the synthetic FX hedge returns are used in Investment Analytics Platform - Performance, they are always used on a synthetic FX forward that has two non-zero legs. This might not be the expected behavior if SCD is setup to calculate the returns using a price method that implicitly treats the FX forward as a single-legged instrument. Since these methods are not recommended from a performance perspective, they are removed as calculation options from the Synthetic FX Hedge Return Calculation Settings window. Instead, the four corresponding P/L price methods are added. These are recommended from a performance perspective since they have market value on both legs.

Fixed calculation of I-spread for forward started bonds/swaps and/or bonds/swaps which are interest only or have non-bullet redemption structure. For bonds/swaps priced with zero coupon yield curve, swap rate on bond/swap maturity is calculated from zero coupon yield curve using syntethic swap which has the same payment dates and coupon terms as original one, but bullet redemption. For forward started bonds/swaps, swap rate is calculated on bond/swap effective(start) date.

What are the problems/motivations for the changes?
When making partial reallocations for positions with a high number of tax lots then a rounding check could end up putting a too big correction on single tax lot. By too big it is meant above 2 times the smallest unit of the currency e.g. 0.02 for EUR or USD). This would cause the golden equation to fail for the corrected tax lot.
Secondly reallocation values for Initial Premium and Discount values could become incorrect.
Thirdly if a tax lot had an incorrect value for Balance Initial Premium and Discount and was fully sold a check would be made which could cause Balance Initial Premium and Discount not to go to zero on the tax lot.

What is the proposed solution?
First the rounding check has been improved so a single lot will not get more than 2 times the smallest unit of the currency. Then later golden equation checks on individual tax lot level will be able to ensure that the golden equation holds per tax lot. As a consequence the rounding check for reallocations will affect more tax lots.
Secondly a correction has been made to ensure correct reallocation values for Initial Premium and Discount values.
Thirdly a correction has been made so a check on Initial Premium and Discount values is not executed for fully sold tax lots.
